result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrel Lavell Strothers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrel Lavell Strothers not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Montrel Lavell Strothers.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Montrel Lavell Strothers appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Montrel Lavell Strothers.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #16CF5405. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Huber. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Montrel Lavell Strothers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi appeared by video for Montrel Lavell Strothers.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing and indigency hearing.  Defendant now qualifies for Public Defender representation and the Office of the State Public Defender will appoint counsel.  Defense withdrew bail motion. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Montrel Lavell Strothers not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is not SPD Eligible. Defendant is scheduled for an Indigency Hearing before the trial court. Court takes no action.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Montrel Lavell Strothers in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Montrel Lavell Strothers in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Montrel Lavell Strothers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request Indigency Hearing and to be heard on bail before the trial court.  
Indigency hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a. 

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
